alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 7:14PM EDT until August 04 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .A line of thunderstorms with heavy rain extended from southwest Grayson County to near Wytheville. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following counties, in northwest North Carolina, Ashe. In southwest Virginia, Grayson, Smyth and Wythe. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Blue Spring Creek, Big Laurel Creek, Big Horse Creek, Dean Branch, Deans Branch, Comers Creek, Cold Run, Comers Rock Branch, Cripple Creek and Dickey Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wytheville... Rural Retreat... Sugar Grove... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Speedwell... Whitetop... Troutdale... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
